title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Home Affairs Minister Peter Dutton will use new powers to keep a violent asylum seeker from entering Australia. Under contentious medevac legislation, doctors cleared an Iran woman to be brought to the mainland for psychiatric treatment. They also recommended her brother and father be allowed to accompany her - even though they did not require medical attention. Minister Dutton approved the woman and her brother to enter the country but has blocked her father from joining them. The government has received intelligence the man has a violent history - linked to drugs and prostitution, according to The Courier Mail.
